From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


This article needs a plot summary. Please add one in your own words. (August 2023) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)


2021 Indian filmTuesdays and FridaysTheatrical release posterDirected byTaranveer SinghWritten byTaranveer SinghProduced bySanjay Leela BhansaliBhushan KumarStarringAnmol Dhillo Jhataleka MalhotraNiki WaliaZoa MoraniNayan ShuklaSammy Jonas HeaneyShivam BhaargavaReem ShaikhCinematographyEwan MulliganEdited byRajesh PandeyMusic bySanchit Balhara  Ankit BalharaProductioncompaniesT-Series FilmsBhansali ProductionsDistributed byAA FilmsRelease date
19 February 2021 (2021-02-19)
CountryIndiaLanguageHindi
Tuesdays and Fridays is a romantic comedy film directed by Taranveer Singh and produced by Sanjay Leela Bhansali and Bhushan Kumar.[1] The movie was released on 19 February 2021 stars Anmol Dhillo, Jhataleka Malhotra, Niki Walia, Zoa Morani, Nayan Shukla, Kamini Khanna, Sammy Jonas Heaney and Reem Shaikh.[2][3][4]


Cast[edit]
Jhataleka Malhotra as Sia Malhotra
Anmol Dhillon as Varun Sarin
Zoa Morani as Kajal
Aashim Gulati as Jatin Singh
Shivam Bhaargava as Achal Deoda
Reem Shaikh as Tanya
Eklavey Kashyap as Nabeel
Anuradha Patel as Nimmi Sarin
Niki Aneja Walia as Dr. Radhika Malh
Sammy Jonas as Heaney William
Nayan Shukla as Pats
Release[edit]
The movie was released on 18 February 2021.[citation needed]

Reception[edit]
Critical reception[edit]
The Times of India has given 2/5.[5] Cinema Express has given 1/5.[6]
FirstPost has given 0.5.[7]

References[edit]


^ "'Tuesdays and Fridays' director on his debut film being a 'story of two reluctant romantics'". WION. Retrieved 20 June 2023.

^ "Sanjay Leela Bhansali Productions Tuesdays And Fridays to release on February 19". India Today. Retrieved 20 June 2023.

^ "Zoa Morani to play an NRI in Sanjay Leela Bhansali's Tuesdays and Fridays". Mumbai Mirror.

^ Desk, NH Web (4 February 2021). "'Tuesdays and Fridays' trailer: Jhataleka Malhotra shines in her debut outing". National Herald. Retrieved 20 June 2023.

^ "Tuesdays & Fridays Movie Review : A love story with a novel concept and a fresh pair, but doesn't really warm your heart". The Times of India. ISSN 0971-8257. Retrieved 20 June 2023.

^ "Tuesdays and Fridays Movie Review: Twee rom-com loses the day". The New Indian Express. Retrieved 20 June 2023.

^ "Tuesdays & Fridays movie review: Anmol Dhillon, Jhataleka Malhotra's film is an Imtiaz Ali romance sans personality". Firstpost. 20 February 2021. Retrieved 20 June 2023.
